definitions.definition: To inflect (a verb) for each person, in order, for one or more tenses; to list or recite its principal parts .
examples: In English, the verb 'to be' is conjugated as follows: 'I am', 'you are', 'he/she/it is', 'we are', 'you are', 'they are'.

definitions.definition: To multiply on the left by one element and on the right by its inverse .
To join together, to unite ; to juxtapose .
To temporarily fuse, exchanging or transferring DNA .

main_definition: ( grammar , transitive ) To inflect (a verb) for each person, in order, for one or more tenses; to list or recite its principal parts .
secondary_definitions: ( mathematics ) To multiply on the left by one element and on the right by its inverse .
( rare ) To join together, to unite ; to juxtapose .
( biology , of bacteria and algae ) To temporarily fuse, exchanging or transferring DNA .
